description: three figures on the ground--one on hands and knees; a sketched-in fourth figure in URQ
markings: LLC, stamped in black: [SR / (cut off) R]
medium: Pen and brown ink and wash over black chalk on gray paper
provenance: Jonathan Richardson, Jr., Lugt 2170 (1694-1771), London. Sir Joshua Reynolds, Lugt 2364 (1723-1792), London. Carl Robert Rudolf, London (until 1977; his sale, part II, Sotheby's, London, July 4, 1977, no. 12, £560, to Moir); Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (1977-d. 2010; bequeathed to MIA).
title: Three Male Figures Writhing on the Ground, Study for a Resurrection, Pentecost, or Conversion of St. Paul
